alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY AND NORTHWESTERN DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Oldenburg, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Oldenburg, Sunman, St. Leon, Huntersville, Hamburg, Ballstown, Penntown, Weisburg, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Peppertown, Lawrenceville, Saint Peter, and New Alsace. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
